title: slab serif from The Natural
content:
I got to staring at the poster for the Robert Redford movie The Natural.

I've never seen this particular slab serif before.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [natural.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123045257/http:/typophile.com/files/natural.jpg) | 35.66 KB |
author: ralphsmouse

comments.content:
The image seems to be from one of the original posters for the movie, which was released in 1984.  
I suspect it is lettering adapted from a monoline slab serif font such as Rockford. The oversize bowl on the R and the ski jump leg could have been added to evoke a nostalgic retro/deco mood.  
At least I have not seen the combination in a digital or pre-digital monoline slab serif font.  
There is at least one digital font inspired by Rockford that has a ski jump leg on the R similar to the lettering:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123045257im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1984LetteringAndSanchezSlabWithAltR_3715.jpg)
  
The lettering is in red and the font in black.  
It's [Sanchez Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123045257/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/sanchez-slab/), using the alt R.  
Don

Thanks!

Sanchez is a pretty good match.

You brought up a good point about the nostalgic touch on the R.

This being from the pre-digital age, I applaud whoever put all that work into doing a one-off.

Following Don's suggestion of Sanchez, [Trend](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123045257/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/trend) Slab, coming from the same foundry Latinotype, could also be an interesting substitute. X-height looks closer to your original sample, only needs /R leg to be tweaked.
Ah, great suggestion Ryuk, very close match!
